page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Copplestone is a fairly small village in the country, at the junction of the A377 and the A3072 to Okehampton.There have recently been some council houses built. There is 1 shop which is a cross between a Post Office and general stores, Rosemary's hair stylist,and a pub called The Cross Hotel. There is a flourishing Chapel but no church. There are 2 garages, a village hall which is used by the playgroup, and a playing field. Daveys Mill and Stoneman's agricultural suppliers are the main businesses in the village together with an an abattoir. There is a station on the line from Exeter to Barnstaple which is unmanned; trains stop by request. At the other end of Copplestone is the old Shirley Corner school. It was closed in 1975, and replaced by the new building we are in now.
